ArticleTitle.sentence: Octamer transcription factors and the cell type-specificity of immunoglobulin gene expression.

event.clue: Octamer transcription factors and the cell type-specificity of immunoglobulin gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: Antibodies are produced exclusively in B lymphocytes.

event.clue: Antibodies are produced exclusively in B lymphocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: The expression of the antibody-encoding genes, the immunoglobulin (Ig) genes, is also restricted to B cells.

event.clue: The expression of the antibody-encoding genes, the immunoglobulin (Ig) genes, is also restricted to B cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The octamer sequence ATGCAAAT is present in the promoter and the enhancer of Ig genes, and plays an important role in its tissue-specific expression.

event.clue: The octamer sequence ATGCAAAT is present in the promoter and the enhancer of Ig genes, and plays an important role in its tissue-specific expression.

AbstractText.sentence: This sequence motif is a binding site for nuclear proteins, the so-called octamer transcription factors (Oct or OTF factors).
The Oct-1 protein is present in all cell types analyzed so far, whereas Oct-2A and Oct-2B are found mainly in B lymphocytes.

event.clue: The Oct-1 protein is present in all cell types analyzed so far, whereas Oct-2A and Oct-2B are found mainly in B lymphocytes.
The Oct-1 protein is present in all cell types analyzed so far, whereas Oct-2A and Oct-2B are found mainly in B lymphocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: All three proteins show the same sequence specificity and binding affinity.

It appears that the B cell-specific expression of Ig genes is mediated at least in part by cell type-specific Oct factors, and that there are both quantitative and qualitative differences between Oct-1 and Oct-2 factors.

event.clue: It appears that the B cell-specific expression of Ig genes is mediated at least in part by cell type-specific Oct factors, and that there are both quantitative and qualitative differences between Oct-1 and Oct-2 factors.

AbstractText.sentence: Recently, a number of other octamer factor variants were identified.
Many of these may be created by alternative splicing of a primary transcript of one Oct factor gene and may serve a specific function in the fine tuning of gene expression.
